 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָעַד‎</span>] **verb** ==tremble, quake== (Late Hebrew ***id.***, Hiph\`il ***shake*** (rare), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רְעָדָה‎</span> ***a trembling, shaking***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***thunder*** (said of sky), VIII. ***tremble, quiver***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***tremble***; Jewish-Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎רְעַד‎</span> ***tremble, shake***); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתִּרְעָ֑ד‎</span> [[Ps.104.32|Ps 104:32]] and it (the earth) ***trembleth*** at the gaze of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, in theoph. **Hiph\`il** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָמַדְתִּי מַרְעִיד‎</span> [[Dan.10.11|Dan 10:11]] ***I stood trembling***; plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַרְעִדִים‎</span> [[Ezra.10.9|Ezra 10:9]], with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָשַׁב‎</span>.
